My issue with this restaurant is not the food but the acoustics- it is LOUD in here.  I couldn't hear the people sitting at my own table. Overall though, a pretty decent place.

I think this restaurant is overrated. I do have to say that the waiter was excellent. The bread they gave us was nothing special. We ordered the shrimp cocktail for the appetizer and it was very good shrimp  We ordered salads with blue cheese dressing and blue cheese crumbles.  The salad was good.  What we really went there for was the steak.  I ordered the 5-ounce filet mignon (medium)...supposed to be pink in the center, all the way through.  It was not and there was no flavor to the meat at all. I could not eat it.  My husband order the small ribeye and it was the same, was not pink all the way though the center and it had no flavor. He could not eat his, either.  The waiter did not come back to see how we liked the steaks, so we did not want to wait for another. The baked potatoes were forgettable.  Nice ambiance, but we won't go back.

Found DC Steak House via Groupon.  Overall the experience was a pleasant one. Our waiter was very professional and attentive. Bread was fresh but nothing to write home about.  Steaks were very nice and cooked just right.  Ribeye could have been more tender and had a bit of gristle, but not too bad.  Flavor was great.  My friend was very pleased with his filet.    Sweet potato fries were very good, but a baked sweet potato would have been a better option, in my opinion.  Chocolate lava cake was wonderful!  Definitely one of the best I've had.  The only thing that took away from the experience involved the menu.  The menu on their web site says the 12 oz. filet is priced at $41.  The menu we were handed in the restaurant said the 12 oz. filet is priced at $41.  BUT, when my friend ordered the 12 oz. filet, the waiter explained that the price had gone up to $47.  Seriously?  The price has gone up, but the menu hasn't been changed?  No sticker?  No sharpie turning the 1 into a 7?  Just wait for someone to order and THEN explain it costs more?  Not very professional!

I had to break the trend of decent reviews for DC Steak House, I really did want to like it.  Downtown Chandler has needed a place like this and we had really high hopes for it.  They bill themselves as being between the lower end and the higher end steak houses and they nailed it when it comes to the final bill, sadly they didn't when it comes to the food.  I honestly believe that this is the first steak house I have ever been to that would not let me substitute out the side house salad for a side ceaser salad.  The waiter told me that he could get fired if he asked the kitchen to do that for me.  Even the lower end places allow that.  When it came to the steak, I ordered the $31 fillet which was probably a decent cut of meat, but my definition of medium rare and their definition seems to be very different.  There was no way that my steak was anything other than medium well.  I wouldn't mind paying something higher than what I can get at the national chain places if I actually had a meal that was better than what I can get at those same chains.

Loved this place...such an elegant but casual vibe with friendly and efficient servers, amazing food, and a one of a kind experience. The moscato I had was delicious! We had shrimp cocktail, a pork chop sandwich, open faced steak sandwich, and key lime pie for dessert. It's hard to cook a steak well done and have it still be juicy and tender. The chef was amazing...the steak literally melted in my mouth! And the key lime pie was heaven. I'll definitely be back.

Dinner last night,party of 6.  Waiter was overextended with 4 or 5 tables.  Every request required multiple conversations.  Salads were brutal....warm and not fresh. Bread was cold and getting drinks refilled was a task.  Mgr told us that they were short staffed and our waiter was also filling in as the bartender.  Thank You very much for the one and done visit.  By the way the steaks were really good but the overall experience was not  If the was a 0 star rating that would be it

Highly disappointed, our friends came down from California for d fist time since we've moved here and we researched this place because we love steak and my friends knows a lot about beef being his from Wisconsin, we ordered the ribeye and it lacked flavor, I pour salt on that steak so much that it made me just plainly sad to have in front of me a great looking and cooked steak with no flavor at all, the salad had hardly any dressing I had to ask for more and  to top this off we got home and within a few hrs my husband and 2 friends were vomiting and were exploding from all ends and my both rooms and even tubs and sinks were destroyed , luckily for myself besides a bad tummy pain I was spared from vomiting.  Bottom line is that we paid a pretty penny for a great meal and experience and it gave us food poisoning.  Sunday December 20th

Great location in downtown Chandler. Opted for indoor dining and we weren't disappointed. The service was timely and friendly. Our waiter new his menu and took our order promptly. Cold crab appetizers was fresh and delicious. Recommend the veal chop. A little pricey but worth it. Check it out.

The food delish!!  Steve's shrimp great as always; steaks done perfectly, desserts out of this world(limoncello cake so light and tasty and chocolate molten cake with ace cream were both to die for.  This is a wonderful restaurant for Chandler to have.

For our first visit we picked outside seating to enjoy the perfect Arizona evening.  Our waitress stopped over to the table and introduced herself to us and asked about our drinks.  After we ordered, we shared with her that this was our first time there and wanted her opinion on what the signature dishes were so we could sample the best the place had to offer.  She highlighted the menu was filled with steaks and chops - delightful because that's right up my alley.  We ordered a fillet cooked medium and a rare ribeye, along with the salads and sides.  Our drinks and warm bread came promptly and we enjoyed conversation while the jazz laced with a heavy Sinatra influence continued to frame the evening.  Our salads followed along in short order.  Traditional dinner salads with light but nicely flavored dressings that didn't overpower the natural flavors.  Just as we were finishing, our entrees arrived with near perfect timing.    I'm an advocate of great dinning experiences and a part of that is presentation.  My ribeye cut was perfectly seared with large squared markings served with sauteed mushrooms and garnished tastefully.  A side of sweet potato fries completed the dish.  The steak was tender, juicy and naturally flavored with light seasoning.  No unnatural or heavy seasoning added to mask the taste or the very high quality cut.  Cutting into the ribeye was really a pleasure.  Nice marbling, wonderful flavor that still makes my mouth water thinking about it today.  The sauteed mushrooms were a perfect compliment to the rich flavor of the steak.  Perfectly cooked to my liking, rich and rare. The sweet potato fries were thin but the salt and slightly sweet flavor came out in just the right balance.  Overall an exceptional experience and we'll certainly return soon.

We were hesitant in trying DC Steakhouse because of the recent negative reviews, but our experience here was fantastic. We didn't make reservations, thinking it wouldn't be that busy on a Tuesday evening, but to our surprise it was packed when we arrived. The ambience is nice and upscale. Like another reviewer mentioned, it's a bit dark and a little loud, but that didn't bother us at all.   We ended up sitting at the bar for about a half hour and enjoyed a few drinks while we waited for an open table. The bartender was sweet and made a few recommendations from the menu, so by the time we got to our table, we were ready to order (and starving!) Our server, Spencer, was attentive from start to finish. Our glasses were never empty and our plates cleared promptly. As for the most important part, the food: both my husband's steak and my blackened salmon were cooked to perfection and mouth-wateringly delicious. My husband said it was the best steak he's had in years. Our side dishes were excellent as well. I had every intention of enjoying a dessert here, but there was no room for that this time.  It was an enjoyable meal and we will definitely be back. My advice: don't let the negative reviews scare you away!! Also, there's a Groupon special going on right now. Just purchased mine :)
Michael is the best server ever!!!! He had great wine recommendations, and was super attentive to our needs.  I highly recommend this place and Michael.

Since someone had already mentioned the lobster tail I thought I would give it a go. I came for the steak but will come back for the lobster. I could have used a bigger one probably because it was so good. Yes, as a matter of fact it was the best I've ever had. The other people in our party had the steak. Sirloin and filet. They both said it was fantastic. Love the shrimp cocktail, even though $4 a shrimp is quite pricey. Asparagus great! Service was great. I had no problem in that area.

Went to the DC twice this last week while visiting. Both times I went in late for dinner and had the Filet Mignon - wow! It was terrific! I ordered it a tad over medium and it came out perfectly cooked. It was so tender and delicious...my mouth is watering right now thinking about it! And what a value.. any steakhouse you go, to you pay well over $35 for the meat alone and get ala carted to death - not here! The steak was priced in the $20s and included a soup or salad, as well as a side dish! Oh and mushrooms! Mushrooms alone can cost you $9 at other steakhouses. ( Just went to another steakhouses website and priced out my meal...at those "high end chains" my meal would have cost $52! )  I just love the atmosphere! The dark lighting makes it feel so intimate and the murals on the wall are beautiful!   Another plus - its family owned and operated! Hate giving my money to all the big chains! The owners are from Wisconsin, so you know you will get that great midwestern charm!

This hands down is the best restaurant in Chandler! The atmosphere gets a 10, it's charming and quaint. The lighting is perfect, it's dim which makes for a romantic dinner! I love the fact that this restaurant has character and is not like a new chain restaurant!  DC steak is way better than Maestros and Ocean club in Scottsdale; I would choose DC steak over those two any day! Not to mention the menu prices are very reasonable!!! The grilled shrimp were a 10 and the best mash potatoes I have ever eaten! The vodka tonics were great with a  good pour. I can't wait to go back!! The service was excellent!!!

Great place...warm, cozy, elegantly lit and lots of interesting decor and things to look at.  It's in a nice location on the corner in DTC.  Service was good and the bartenders were attentive.  Unfortunately my trend continues, regardless of the steakhouse, of being nothing but disappointed with the cost to enjoyment ratio when eating steak outside the house.  YES it is good and YES the quality is good but just not that much better than I can bust out with a steak from Costco and my backyard grill at one tenth the price.  Dropped $410 here for two couples noting we had two bottles of moderately priced wine.  Considering that, I think I have finally learned my lesson that I'm just not a steakhouse guy.  I'll work on the fish and I'll leave the bovines for other folk.    If you are steak junky I'm pretty sure you will love this place.  Better than most for sure but if you casually like steak like me, you might find your ass a little too light on the way out.

Horrid service.  The steaks were okay -- the owner, the staff, and the service were an absolute nightmare.   Don't bother making a reservation--it won't be honored. I had AMEX Centurion make the reservation two-weeks in advance so we'd have a good table and we still got shoved to the back of the restaurant for a "big party" that would be occupying the tables near the front windows.   Quick Note: The "big party" never got seated before we'd eaten and paid the bill.   BUT!! The big party people did show up in the bar area where we'd been seated (despite our reservation) and gathered all round our table for an OPEN-BAR happy hour thrown by the I'm flying solo, birthday girl herself and proceeded to get drunk and loud just INCHES from our table--sometimes butt-bumping our backs as we tried to hurry up and consume our steaks. The staff and management did NOTHING to remedy this problem other than to offer us a free round of drinks(we declined). We had to ask the people ourselves to respect our space, which with a large group of drinkers was pointless.   Speaking of the management -- if you're a day under 70 the owner won't visit your table. A "manager" will come by one time and dispassionately ask how things are, but not the owner. He hung out at all of the tables chatting with folks from Sun Lakes.  No one who seemed to be in charge really acted like they were glad we came there to spend our money.  Actually, no one really was taking charge--leadership was in short supply.  The experience will make for an excellent business lecture someday.    The waiter: our waiter's service button was turned down to just a shade better than completely ignore. We had to ask him for everything including cracked pepper for the salads and water refills.   Then there was the annoying blonde-ish girl behind the bar who, while attempting to be funny/witty, answered my questions with questions or equivocations.    And it goes on and on--if you've read to here you get the point.  There's not a surprise Disney movie ending where it all got better--it just got worse.    Don't waste your money.    I'd like to have more options in the Downtown Chandler business area and see restaurants stay, but I'll never go back to the DC Steakhouse.

Four of were there for dinner. Three of the four steaks were not cooked according to their own definitions of medium and medium rare. The server seemed to have us non a "pay no mind" list. He messed up one person's order. Completely forgot about the drink orders that were made. Took another server to get our condiments. The steak I had tasted no better than the lower priced counterparts at Texas Roadhouse .

It was the first time my wife and I visited DC Steakhouse and it sure brought back great memories from the past.   The location for this restaurant was previously our favorite hangout for great food and wine years ago when it was 98 South. The location has been through several changes of ownership and concept since 98 South closed and until our visit to DC Steakhouse on 6/19, we never felt the desire to come back.   The decor still exhudes the same vibe as our old haunt and is a comfortable, casual, romantic environment, with background music by some of the greatest singers from an earlier generation... so you can actually enjoy a pleasant conversation without having to yell across the table at each other.  We're not big meat eaters or late diners, and I'm alergic to shrimp, crab & lobster (boo), so we decided to check the place out during happy hour. Our server was very friendly and helpful. Not knowing many of the wines on their list, she was happy go bring a taste of several that we requested. We selected the Hahn Pinot Noir, which provided a pleasant pairing with our menu choices.  The HH offerings seamed to be an excellent value, so for our "appetizer" we ordered the Open-Faced Tenderloin Steak Sandwich ($7) which came with sweet potato fries. We ordered it Medium and it came Medium Well, but we were still pleasantly surprised flavor wise. It's an excellent value and we'll definitely be back to try some of the other HH selections whenever we feel like dining early. Hopefully the next time, the steak will come served as ordered, as one would expect from a place with "Steakhouse" in their name.  For the entré, I ordered the pan fried Walleye pike ($21) with mixed green salad and wth baked potato, which we shared. You don't find Walleye often in Arizona restaurants and since we both grew up in the Midwest it's a must try. The fish was fresh, flavorful and highly satisfying. We'll definitely order it again, perhaps the broiled version... although the Cajun Salmon did catch our eye. Decisions, decisions, decisions.  TIP, there is a "shared plate" charge of $10, but their Happy Hour sandwiches count as an entré, so if you're like us and usually share an appetizer and entré, go during HH to avoid the shared plate fee.  While we still miss the original 98 South and the eclectic menu from PT Barnum, DC Steakhouse has been added to the "take our friends" list of go to places whenever we venture outside Gilbert. It's definitely a reason for a drive to old town Chandler.

I don't understand why this place has such high reviews. It was such a disappointment. The bread had a weird soggy texture, totally tasteless. We got salads with the house dressing but it had chunks of peppercorn in it. My stepfather and I both ordered the 1/2 rack. It was ok. Def not worth $18! I've had better ribs at TGIF lol my mom got the pike fish. She said on a scale of 1 to 10 she'd give it a 6. But what angered me the most was that we had to wait over an hour for our food! If u wait a long time and the food is worth it than fine but it so wasn't worth it. I will say the wait staff was really very professional and on point.

The stars are only for the bar, which I would give it five except we had dinner in the restaurant and that knocked it down two.  First the bar. Great bartenders, really nice bar, awesome cocktails. But then we sat for dinner. Disappointing service and the food is subpar. It didn't help that our waitress got our order wrong. It also didn't help that we ordered not only the lobster tail but a lobster add-on, specifically requested that they not overcook. Both came out extremely dry and were sent back.  We never were served any bread. We had the house salad with blue cheese dressing that obviously came from a vat in the back labled BluCheez. But really our waitress was not good at all. She clearly didn't want to be there, really had no interest in us and it showed. The steak wasn't that great either. First, it wasn't the one I ordered but also it was over seasoned and had some kind of sauce on it. The only reason we'd come back is for a drink at the bar.

The DC stands for "Downtown Chandler".  It's a casual steak house.  Since I'm not from Chandler, and not familiar with other steak options, I'd say this is likely the best place in Chandler.   Let me say first this is a great spot as for Chandler options..but not against other top notch options in Phoenix and Scottsdale.  It's a neighborhood steak house, and they do an amazing job at that.  The service and food (filet) and loaded baked potato were great.    I'd say lose the Wisconsin Cheese Curds as an appetizer...who eats mozzarella sticks before an awesome steak? Need to change that.  (I didn't order cheese curds, my date did)  They had a bunch of dessert options but I was so full...from mozzarella sticks/cheese curds, salad and filet.    If you are looking for a family/casual style steakhouse in Chandler swing on by. Might be some kids/might be some grandma's/grandpa's or both, but just be prepared for that type of crowd.   Bon Appetit!
The food here was extremely good and the service was great! Highly Recommend eating here!
First visit with my wife tonight on our date night. We stumbled by it and it was such a treat. Great steaks, great atmosphere, and good service. Was a little pricy but made for a great night out!

Took 5 other people there on a Thursday night for a business dinner. Jake did a great job taking care of us.   I ordered shrimp appetizers,  one cold and one hot plus calamari for the table.   The shrimp were huge and perfectly cooked.  I had the salmon which was awesome.  Others had steak,  shrimp,  and other appetizers.   Everyone seemed to enjoy their meals.  One ordered chocolate cake for dessert which got passed around.   Plenty to share and my bite was delicious.  Entrees here are priced below most of the upscale Steakhouses and include a salad and side!  Great place for special occasions or just a casual dinner with friends.
Service was excellent. Steaks were amazing. Calamari was delicious as was grilled asparagus. Great ambiance.

I want to love this place so bad. It's convenient, and it's the neighborhood steakhouse.   They have a fabulous happy hour that I absolutely love.  The happy hour keeps us coming back week after week. Especially the filet sandwich...to die for.  Unfortunately, every time we have ventured off the happy hour for a sit down meal with steaks, baked potato, and the works, we leave disappointed :-( the most recent disappointment was our medium rare steak being significantly undercooked. C'mon guys when your paying $40 for a steak, you expect it to be correct. The restaurants solution is to leave your potato and lobster at the table to get cold while they re-cook your same steak. Frustrating!  So we ate the sides by itself so they wouldn't get cold, and vow never to eat anything BUT the happy hour.

We always enjoy going here; especially with a $25 coupon. Sign up on their mailing list. We have received 2 coupons in the past year.  The steaks are great and well seasoned. Ditto for the fish.  Their wines are good and a must!!  Service is balanced- good yet not intrusive.

I hadn't been here for years despite living in Chandler for 20 years. A high school friend and his wife came up last week for a visit and said the place looked good. I told them the last time I visited was Mother's Day the food was delicious so we obliged.   Great service from Shelly and fantastic food that night So much so that my husband and I came back a week later (tonight) and we had dinner at the bar.  I enjoyed a phenomenal 5 Oz filet mignon steak  - cooked medium rare so perfect it melted in my mouth! My husband really liked the lobster and steak!   We were also wonderfully entertained by Chudini at the bar - great street magician who also bartends!

The Good:  Atmosphere was lovely. They have a really cute space.  Our server was super sweet.  The French fries are tasty.  Their mushrooms were tasty too.  The Meh:  My husband said his steak was ok. Not quite as good as we can do at home with meat from the butcher, not quite as good as Texas Roadhouse, but not as bad as Outback or Applebees.   After all of the following "bad", the lovely server brought us a slice of cake on the house. (Nice & relatively tasty if a tad bit dry, however we're on a diet so only ate a couple bites anyhow.)   The Bad:  To spite their sign containing the word "cocktail" they do not actually have fruit here. That means if you order something like a Gin Ricky, all you get  is disappointment in a glass. (Bar lime = Gross) This may not be a big deal to most, but we came here because of wanting a nice cocktail. Hell, it was in the sign! A very bad start.  The bread they give you pre-meal is dry, cold, and reminiscent of averaged sliced bread.   The salad was a nice blend of lettuce, but no idea why they serve it with a full quarter of a tomato. (Seriously? Dice or spring for cherry tomatoes) Also, maybe find a new source for pepperoncinis, maybe one where the peppers aren't petrified like ancient wood.  DO NOT ORDER FISH! Three bites of the Walleye & I had collected half a dozen bones. Not just tiny ribs either. A couple were like ribs + cartilage that were seriously choking hazards. We're very non-confrontational folk, but this was too much. When brought to our servers attention she apologized profusely & offered something else, but said the fish just had bones and a different fillet would probably have them too. I don't know who they have as their chef, but he should be kept far away from fish. All animals have bones! I still don't want to eat them. Any reasonable chef knows to look over a raw filet & pluck ribs. Please, please, please, DO NOT ORDER FISH FOR SMALL CHILDREN OR OLDER FOLK. Not exaggerating, it's a choking hazard & you will get zero warning.  Really wanted to like it here, but will not come back. Get some fruit to offer a "complete" bar & maybe find a more experienced chef. I don't expect perfection, but for the price point this should have been much better.

Excellent pan fried walleye coupled with a good salad blue cheese dressing and good baked potato. Appetizer of deep fried mushrooms very good. Portions very liberal. Jessie our server most attentive and friendly as well as helpful. The walleye really did make it great.

We went to this restaurant on a Friday night and finding parking was very difficult.  We ended up parking several blocks away and walking a distance to the restaurant.  Definitely make reservations as the place was packed.  The food was very good, but pricey. Also, it was very noisy. I could just barely hear my date above the din. All-in-all, this is a good restaurant,  but not a great one.

One of the best meals I've had in a long time.  My bone in Ribeye (this girl goes all out with steak) was cooked perfectly.  The side items were a perfect compliment.  We sat at the bar so enjoyed meeting Mandi.  She gives top notch service.

Service was AMAZING!! Had Daniel as a waiter. He was very in tune with the fact we were with another couple trying to catch up on time past and did not interrupt once. He had other tables and still let us take our time and set the pace for the evening. We had an appetizer, good. We had salads, all good. We had one order filet mignon, she let everyone have a taste, melted in your mouth. Two of us had the ribeye, bone out, perfectly cooked medium-rare. One had the bone in ribeye, cooked rare and he said it was great. Way to full to eat dessert but would like to try our next visit. Great date night. We went on a Thursday night and it was pretty busy.

Wife and I skipped out for a night with no kids to enjoy an evening to ourselves.  The ambiance is nice and quiet, which was bliss.  The wait staff is prompt and courteous, without being too formal.  The food was fantastic.  We ordered the shrimp cocktail, which was amazing, including lightly coated prawns (some sort of garlic oil maybe) and a bold, robust cocktail sauce which had the perfect amount of horseradish and kick.  The salads were great. We both had steaks and they came out cooked perfectly like we ordered.  We topped it off with a salted caramel cheesecake dessert which was also something to note.  The manager is a very nice gentleman who always made sure we were taken care of without being overwhelming.  Great experience!  All in all, this is a fantastic dinner spot.  The food was pretty good and on par with most of the steak houses in the area.  I can't wait to go back and try something else.  Big thumbs up for this place!

I enjoyed my first visit at DC a bit ago. It was s celebration dinner. Appetizers to meal were great and flavorful and plentiful.   Always gets busy here since I also live downtown so make reservations and enjoy a nice ambiance, intimate and cozy. Nice bar area in back and a little cramped in the dining room but you'll get past that. Horrible placement of hostess stand though. It felt akward checking in and there's not much cheaper if a wait area so we sat right by it so people stared at us eating the whole time. Great everything else otherwise- staff were friendly, price was acceptable, and food was good (audience or not).

This place is a nice little spot in downtown Chandler they have an awesome selection of local brews as well as a great wine selection. Unfortunately, the food was impressively mediocre. The salad and fries were obviously thrown together in a few seconds .fries appeared to be store bought thick steak fries... The meat was high quality and so was the service. Beyond my overall impression was blahh.
Great ribeye steak and halibut.  Fantastic services.  Robert made our casual night extremely special.

We had reservations last night at 7:30pm, the same night as the Jazz festival.  Seated early and food and service was fantastic.    We will not go back till the lighting improves.  We mentioned it 2 prior visits and all for nothing apparently.  The entire dinner party had to use our phones to read the menus and see our food when it was served,and our table was directly under a light.  I literally touched the light while seated.  We asked our server if it was possible to turn up the lights so we could see, but she stated that they knew the problem, but could not turn up the lights without it being too bright.  A call to a commercial electrician can solve the problem with minimal cost.    We do not like eating in the dark.  We watched numerous patrons using their phones also.  Get with it owner.  Spend the few dollars and fix the lighting.  We have posted this due to lack of response by the owner to fix the problem.   Please post the problem resolved, or we and all our friends will not be back.  DC steakhouse can be better
This is great steakhouse for Chandler, probably the best you'll find in the area! Good food, great service. I love the downtown chandler atmosphere and found this place to be enjoyable.

Visited on a Sunday night and it was packed.  We had a reservation for two and were seated promptly upon arrival. Waitress stopped by fairly soon after and took our drink order. Seemed fine except our two drinks (a beer and a house wine) took about 10 minutes to arrive.    When we ordered, I asked how marbled the top sirloin was. The waitress did not know what marbled meant and had to go to the kitchen to ask someone.  When she returned, I then inquired if they served steaks "oscar" style. She said yes but it was a $15 dollar additional charge which seemed like quite a lot given that the top sirloin by itself was only $21.  She then said that to add a lobster tail was only $12.    Based on her responses, I had no confidence in her and chose to order the fillet with sweet potato fries.  I asked if I could get mashed potatoes instead but she said it would be an extra charge as if I ordered a separate side of mashed potatoes.  I don't like that but at least she told me before I ordered it. So my wife and I both ordered fillets and shortly our salads arrived.  Nothing special here, just basic iceberg, average size.  After that, we had to ask for bread upon noticing other tables with bread baskets.  I was troubled that we needed to ask for it given this "upscale" steakhouse.    Fortunately our food arrived in a decent time and was cooked appropriately for both of us.  My wife ordered the baked potato loaded and it came bare, but immediately they brought out the toppings to correct it.  Our food was perfect and was truly the highlight of the night. In addition to our steaks, I ordered a side of asparagus and it was wonderfully prepared and delicious.  However, after the food arrived, we never saw the waitress again until well after finishing our meals.    So the food is great but the service leaves a lot to be desired both in timeliness but also in knowledge and courtesy for an upscale place.  We used a Groupon otherwise this place may be a crap shoot based on what type of server you get.

Blah! Is how I feel about this place and their food.  First off, no happy hour on a Friday's... no wonder it's so empty.   I came here with a group on Friday night.  We started out with the fried eggplant and calamari.  Neither one was anything to write home about.  The eggplant was flavorless and the calamari, well, was calamari.   My husband had a Mediterranean Mule for a drink, which was probably the best part about our visit.  Bar tending staff was really nice too and our waiter was attentive and got us what we needed.  For our entrees I had the salmon, nothing special, just salmon that came with a pile of wilted lettuce and croutons as a salad.  I didn't even eat it after our sever set it down.   My husband ordered the halibut, pretty tasty, but again came with a wilted pile of lettuce and croutons as a salad.  I had asparagus for my side which was oily and they didn't cut the stems off so it was hard when I bit into it.   My husband ordered lobster Mac n chz for his side.  Lots of Mac n chz, but no lobster in there.  Several other people in my party didn't finish their salads either,  it sure why but I can probably guess... lol.  Chocolate cake and tiramisu  for dessert was just ok.  They're probably not made in house.   This place is over priced and not worth it for the quality of food.  I would rather spend the extra money and go to Ruth's Chris or Fleming's for a nice steak dinner.  Sorry DC steakhouse

Our company comes with a large group at least twice a month. Service is always solid and the ambiance is always great! I do not eat meat so i typically get the swordfish! YUMM. Although this time I tried the Cajun Salmon. The asparagus in a hollandaise sauce is a must try. Good luck saving room for dessert!
Great place fresh food very good service can't miss.  Wisconsonians own and opperate this quaint steakhouse.

Tried the calamari appetizer which was boring... but went on to the surf and turf. Steak was cooked perfect, lobster was amazing... suppose I would have liked more than 3 mushrooms... apparently that's the standard...maybe it's like coffee beans in Sambuca and any other number is bad luck?  In any case... the food was fantastic.

Can't believe we haven't ate here yet! I love the ambiance, a nice break from the super casual norm in DT Chandler. Steaks are very reasonably priced, a perfectly cooked 6oz fillet for $22, including salad, a starch, great bread and great service. We will be back for sure!

Been here 6x. 5 of the visits were very good . . . I'm editing a recent not so positive review for a good reason . . . everyone can have an off night. You know . . .one of those "black hole" nights . . . this Steakhouse is great for downtown Chandler . . .  But moving on . . . the quality of the food is 2nd to none. Great beef ( Rib eye) and they know how to prepare it. Grilled asparagus awesome . . . The service is very friendly and spot on. And the bar . . .ahhhhh . .. great martinis which every top shelf steak house should have. Jeff is an excellent bartender. I look forward to coming back.

I ate here for the first time recently with modest expectations, but I was pleasantly surprised. I ordered the 18-ounce bone-in ribeye. It arrived at my table cooked to perfection, and it was tender, juicy and full of flavor. For my side I had sweet potato fries, which were delicious. Also, the bread that came with the meal was very good, while the salad was average. Service was spot-on. I'd definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants to enjoy an above-average (albeit pricey) steak dinner in Chandler.
I love this place!!! They have great customer service and the food is always wonderful. This place never disappoints. I took my parents here for my mom's birthday and now they can't wait to go back.
The walleye was great the best I have Had since I was back in MN last year

Ate here for the first time a couple nights ago and was very pleased. I had the filet which was cooked perfectly. The salad with honey mustard was also delicious. The service was a bit slow, which is why I'm only giving them 4 stars.  It's priced well for a steak house - I'll definitely done here again.
This place is a hidden gem! Great atmosphere and great food! We started with some excellent Calamari then ordered steaks. The filet and ribeye are awesome!
How do you run a business without a phone.  Their reservation system sucks.  Great food....OK service...but really....answer your frigging phone.

Had heard good things about this restaurant so we decided to try it.  Had an 8 pm reservation for 7 people.  Table wasn't ready when we arrived on time but it was a Sat night and they were busy so we were patient.  Over the next hour we waited as our server made only two stops at our table, one to ask about drinks and one to finally bring them to us.  Finally at 9 pm he stopped by long enough to take our food order very quickly.  At 9:50 our entrees finally arrived.  We did receive a typical dinner salad during the 50 minutes between ordering and receiving the entree.  Mine was prime rib and a baked potato, and I had replied sour cream, no chives to the question re the potato.  I asked for butter for the potato, which NEVER came.  Hubby ordered the pan fried walleye, which can be a bony fish, but in his first two bites he pulled out at least 5 bones, which he laid on the plate.  Finally we flagged down out waiter to show him the bones and he replied that walleye is a bony fish.  I reminded him about butter for the potato.  The manager came by a few minutes later and offered to remake the fish, but the rest of our party was almost halfway through their meals so he declined, based on how late it was and how long the first plate took.  Server never returned until it was time to ask if we had room for dessert.  By this time most of the diners had exited the restaurant and the bar area, which is where we were seated, became quite noisy.  Despite continued waves at our server to hand him the bill and credit cards, he was more interested in what was happening at the bar.  I finally picked up the check and payment and walked over to the bar to flag down the manager.  That's when the server came running over and I reminded him he had never brought the butter and that his service was below par.  I also told the manager that she should have removed the fish from the bill.  Because we didn't accept her offer to remake the fish she felt we should pay for the bony fish, which was not eaten.  I reminded her about the length of time we waited for service and food and she told me that if we were unhappy we should have come to find her and she would have "sped things up."  So the slow service was our fault because we didn't come to find her? She finally agreed to remove the fish dish from the bill and apologized and said "next time, come and find me."  Reading the reviews, it seems like this restaurant is very inconsistent and most of the complaints are about service, not the food quality.  What a shame.  Not sure if we will come back, and if we do decide to give them another shot, it certainly won't be on a busy night.  If they can't handle the business on a Saturday in August, I'd hate to see what happens to this place during the busy winter!
Always have a fantastic meal and amazing service!!  Great prices for really good food.

Normally this place has been very competent. Sometimes businesses when they get a little long in the tooth start to relax a bit too much.   I ordered lobster tails, sadly the wait was very long to get them, when they showed up one was perfect the other was like cotton.   Due to the wait, I decided to power through and eat them both with generous amounts of butter on the latter.   When the bill came, I told them that one was very sub- standard. They told me that since I ate it, there was nothing they could do other than give me a dessert.   I have been here so many times and have rarely ever walked away with a small bill. Usually it's been business dinners.   What bugged me was the attitude that I might have lied about the quality because I ate it. They told me that there is no way that they can tell what the quality of the lobster is. That struck me as an odd statement.   The manager also mentioned that all their lobsters are fresh, never frozen yet delivered as tails only.  Who has ever heard of this?  The statement seemed disingenuous based on anything I have ever known about lobster.   Other than this issue, I have usually had a good experience.  It's too bad this has to happen. It's soured me a bit.

Have been to the DC a few times now and every time it has been extraordinary! I am  not from here, but every time I make it down to Phoenix I make the drive out to Chandler for a steak at the DC with my fiance!  Why would you wanna go to a chain and put more money into the big corporations when you can support a family owned restaurant  Maybe its just a midwestern thing, but where I am from, we support our local families!  Our night started out with a warm greeting from the hostess.  We called ahead for reservations and she asked if we wanted to go to our table right away.  We wanted to have a few cocktails first so we decided to start at the bar.  I ordered a Cosmo ($8.00) and my fiance had a glass of wine($6.00).  Drinks were great and priced very reasonably!! Bartender was very professional and friendly.    After we finished our cocktails, we sat at a cute table by the window. Jake our waiter appeared soon after, brought us another round of drinks, and took our food order.  For appetizers we started out with Wisconsin Cheese Curds, of course! For Dinner I ordered the New York Strip Medium rare and my fiance had a Filet medium well.  The cheese curds tasted just like back home in WI - YUM!!   Shortly after finishing our cheese curds, our salads were delivered.  Fresh, crisp and Green! Exactly how a salad should be!  Oh - and its included with your dinner! If you go downtown Phoenix to one of those chains, expect to pay $6-7 alone for your salad!  Now for the best part - the steaks!! Seriously - my NY Strip was one of the best I ever had!  It was cooked to perfection!  16oz - I ate about 3/4 and will have the rest for lunch tomorrow - cant wait!! And the mushrooms that are included with it - my mouth is still watering thinking about them!   My fiance said his filet (8oz) was extremely tender and cooked just right as well! Good job DC - another wonderful dinner!  When it comes to dessert, Tiramisu is my weakness and their homemade tiramisu was to die for!!   As we finished our dinner, Dean the owner (or Dino he goes by I think) stopped by the table to check on us and say hello.   We met him last time we came in. How many times can you say the owner of a place stopped at your table just to say HI and thanks for coming in! You can tell he truly appreciated our business.   Overall, dinner and drinks came out to just a tad over $110 and it was one of the best meals I ever had! (Compare that to like $200 downtown).  I gladly left a 25% tip - Jake was great!   Cant wait for our next visit down south -we will be back!!!

This place is a Chandler gem, great steaks chops and seafood! Biggest martinis in the Valley and great service, what a great steakhouse should be. We are from Canada, snowbirds who make it a stop every time we visit.

We went to DC steakhouse for happy hour. I was in from out of town and my aunt and grandma really like this place for happy hour. We got there at 4pm when they opened and we were the first ones there.   It took 10 minutes for a server to come up to our table to take our drink orders. You would have thought they were extremely busy. We had to ask for our server twice. That is my only negative regarding this place. The food on the other hand was really good! I ordered the steak sandwich which was delicious. If I end up going back to DC steakhouse when I'm in town next, I will order this again.
Tasteless and  expensive. $12 fruit plate tastes like plastic. And took 30min to prepare an omelette...

Great steak, great service.    The desserts really need to be brought to the next level. Our waiter expressed to our table that they were standard and by the looks and tasteless cheesecake. He was correct
Loved this place, the ambiance was great, food was perfect (steak was highest quality and cooked perfectly) Wine selection was good.  Will recommend DC Steak House to all my friends and family.

We had a great experience at DC Steak House!  The staff was friendly.  Our waitress was extremely knowledgeable of food and wine pairings. She was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed when we needed it. The food was very good.  We all ordered our steaks medium and they came out perfectly pink in the middle.  We also had lobster tails and they may have been slightly overcooked, but we all ate every bite! If we lived close, we would be there again!

The five of us came here last evening for dinner around 6 pm and had a nice time. Downtown Chandler is working very hard at becoming a foodie destination.   The only drawback with our visit to DC Steak House was that they had us sitting in the very noisy bar area. So much for our two week old reservation. LOL It didn't ruin our experience, but it was hard to hear everyone at different times.   We skipped the appetizers, since we heard their desserts were amazing.   Two of us ordered the Salmon Filet, one had the BBQ Ribs, another the Prime Rib (special) and I had the 8 oz Filet Mignon, with two Cajun cooked Shallops (see photos).  All of us felt the food was in the good, to very good range.  Our entrees came with a dinner salad and were in the $24 to $30. My two Scallops, were seasoned just right and very tasty at $6.00 each.   For dessert, we shared their outstanding Chocolate Layer Cake ($9.00) and the Tiramisu ($7.00), which was good and very moist.   The damage came to $190.85 before taxes and gratuities for the five of us. It also included four beers ($18.00), three coffees ($8.85) and a Cappuccino ($5.00) for me. So expect to pay $40 each. Maybe next time we'll be allowed to sit with the grown ups in the dinning room. LOL

My husband and I are new to the area and tried DC Steakhouse after seeing a groupon for the restaurant.  I am sometimes skeptical of groupon offers because I think if the restaurant is good it should not need to discount but in this case I am really glad we tried it!  DC's is located in the historic downtown area of Chandler and had a really nice atmosphere.   The steak was fantastic and the add on lobster was really good.  Our server, Spencer, was very attentive.  Overall we were very happy with the ambiance, quality of food,  reasonable prices for a quality experience and good service.  We will definitely go back!

This restaurant has horrible customer service standards and policies ! My friend had bought a 4 person  groupon for her sisters bday, and planned on going with her husband, sister, and sisters husband. Her husband passed shortly before the bday dinner, and when the  3 person group showed up, DC Steakhouse refused to honor the groupon because there was no 4th person!! They explained the circumstances, and offered to buy the meal for the absent 4th person, the steakhouse still would not budge. How cold can a company be to refuse service for a group of high paying customers, who had just been put into a devastating position. I would never spend a dime at an establishment with such poor customer relations practices.

We decided to stop into DC Steak House on our trip to Chandler, AZ and had an amazing dinner experience.  Our server, Kristen from LA, was pleasant and attentive and the food was prepared perfectly!  The atmosphere is very inviting and we enjoyed speaking with the hostess as well.  We felt very welcome and would definitely recommend DC Steak House to anyone visiting the area.

Went to DC Steak House for dinner with my family on a Sunday night.  This place was packed!  I am glad that I had a reservation as people were being turned away.  Getting seated was a bit of an issue.  Two parties that came in after us were seated before us.  I had to speak to the hostess to ensure we got seated.  The food was great we all enjoyed our meals.  What I did not enjoy was a lot of additional charges.  I did not find out the "small charge" until the bill arrived and no substitutions are allowed.  So if you do not want a potato you have to pay extra for a vegetable.  Even though they are the same price on the menu  These extra charges increased my daughters meal almost 50% and this is not acceptable.  The food was good but the service issues may prevent me from returning.

Enjoyed another great meal at this place. I go out of my way every time I travel to the Phoenix I have to eat here  Great food, excellent service and atmosphere   I would bring a date or do any business meeting here without thinking about the cost

Went there for my birthday a couple of years ago. It was average at best.  My son and I gave it another chance and the experience was less than average. The Sizzler would have shamed this place. We had reservations and were sat immediately. It all fell apart after that. We got menus, but no wine list. One would think wine sales have huge margins. 10 minutes after we sat down a server appeared and asked us if we had been helped, no. She was kind, brought us a wine list and offered to bring us bread. For the first time in my 58 years a server brought me bread that was cold to the touch.  My water glass was dirty had salt residue as if it had been used as a Margarita glass. My butter knife was water spotted and had an oily sheen. No, I didn't use it. I ordered the ribeye, commonly known as the king of steaks. It came out as ordered, medium rare, but trying to eat it was like I could imagine like wrestling a bear. A cheap ribeye from Fry's would have put this to shame. I rarely complain at restaurants, but this was like shooting fish in a barrel. I am one that eats steak until I pop. I struggled through half of this and stopped.  We asked to have a box to take the unfinished meat home to our dogs. The server came back and told us the manager would comp us for my steak only if we didn't take home the uneaten portion. That only added insult to injury. I love downtown Chandler, but spend your money anywhere other than DC Steakhouse.  I told the server about my concerns

Only been here one time. Went for my in-laws anniversary. I had the small filet and I have to say it was the most tender filet I've ever had in my whole life. Yes this place is very expensive, but it was delicious. Everyone in our group loved their meal. I can't remember what else I had as I'm making this post months after our visit. One con that I can remember is that the tables I thought were too close together. Made it hard if you needed to get up and go to the bathroom.

While the service was a bit slow, it is worth going to DC Steak House for the food in itself.  It took us 2 1/2 hours from start to finish.  Partly because the staff was elusive and not attentive when we needed them to be.  The restaurant on the other hand should be commended for how clean it is. So clean that the bartenders even smell the glasses before pouring any liquids into them.  That says a lot about the care they take with their patrons.  The food was awesome!  I had a "medium" 6 ounce filet mignon that cut like butter.  The baked potato was your average potato nothing wrong, nothing great, just average. Mushrooms are included with their steak preparation.  I do not eat any mushrooms and found it quite easy to maneuver around them so they did not get in my way.  By the way, they do not make soups, so please do not ask then what the soup of the day is.  Their dessert was outstanding!  I had the tiramisu which I could tell was made with real cream that makes such a difference.   Overall if you are looking for great food, this is where you would want to go.

Great food!     Came here with the Family for a birthday dinner.    It was a lovely evening.     Server was nice, helpful and prompt with the ice tea refills.   Which I always appreciate!      Steaks were perfect!    Super tender and flavorful!!     We will definitely go back!!

We have visited DC Steak House frequently over the past few years, always with good results.  Better than average food and friendly staff.  But the last couple of times we have visited the steaks have been less than tasty.  They were chewy and flavorless,  We were very disappointed,  We did not even attempt to finish the steaks as the baked potato was far more appealing.  The staff was once again friendly and provided great service, but I have to wonder if they switched meat suppliers and went with a less expensive alternative that provided them with lower quality cuts of beef?  I do not mind paying for a quality steak, but to be charged for a premium steak and receive something far less.........I can't do that. We love the location and the staff, but until you guys verify that the steaks are worth the price of admission, we will be trying other dining destinations.

What a disaster.   Do not ever do reservations here.  This place takes our reservation for 10 at 7:30 on Christmas Eve. Our party shows up at 7:20 as expected and are told they are an hour behind schedule. Will do nothing to address the issue, and is almost indignant to the problem.  No other fine dining restaurant would allow this to happen.  Good food, terrible management, will update with progress thru out our experience to update this abortion.  Management has offered nothing for our now 50 minute wait.  Terrible  Finally seated.  Service staff already has appetizers on the table.  Well done  Food was as expected and service was fine.  Do come here if you like good food. Don't come here if you think your reservations mean anything.

DC Steak is a great nice restaurant without having to go in old town or Scottsdale. I consider myself a steak snob when it comes to steak houses and my go to is City Hall Maestros. This place has great steak that i recommend rare Oscar style. They have a good appetizer list with the fried cheese curds. I think this is a little pricey for what it is ( a local steak house) but is a great date night dinner that you don't want to go a long way. Plan on getting a reservation if you are going it is rare to get in without one.

I'm really pissed that I spent so much money here. I went on a weekday for dinner with my two teenage siblings and a baby. We ordered appetizers that took 15 mins for the first one to come out and 30 mins for the second one to come out. The entrees took well over an hour. Pretty ridiculous if you ask me. The calamari was fishy tasting,  the hot wings were not spicy at all but rather way salty and charcoal burnt. My husband ordered the 38 $ filet, I ordered the spaghetti bolognese which for 16 $ I could've gone to cheesecake factory for way better pasta and way bigger servings. The baldish short guy waitor referred to by other yelpers was my waiter and I shit you not, he did not ask if we enjoyed our appetizers, how the filet was cooked or anything. He refilled our waters twice at best. I had to flag him down for my check. Don't treat me poorly based off of my clothes or appearance. This was not a special dinner that I can only afford once in a while, this was a regular evening dinner. My bill was 114 $ for the two of us and the two big kids. As I'm not a b****, I begrudgingly left the 18$ tip which equated to 15%. For service and food that sucked. So disappointed. As other yelpers mention, when your prices are this high, you will be compared to other high end steakhouses. I'd much rather used that money for complete dinner service at Donovan's or hell, even outback would've tasted better.

Had a groupon and wanted to try this place out. We made a reservation so we would be sure to get a table. Service was excellent.  The food on the other hand looked really good but that's as far as it went. There is a chart right on the menu telling you what rare, Med rare etc is going to look like. My husband had the strip steak medium and it was over cooked. I ordered lamb chops medium and it was rare I mean raw. Glad I had the groupon. Don't think we will be going back.

We had a great experience for dinner on the patio. Good wine selections, our steaks were cooked to perfection. The service was excellent and even the hostess was so sweet and friendly. The restrooms were very clean as well. We will be back again!

Great locally owned steakhouse in Downtown Chandler.  The atmosphere is laid back yet romantic and perfect for when you want a nice meal during the week but don't want to drive too far!  The food and service are both wonderful!
Solid steak. I'd recommend them for a nice cut of beef. The steak only came with 3 teenie mushrooms, so that was a disappointment.

Our first time here. We used a groupon. Everything was superb. My husband is very particular, and he said "The best meal I've had in a while." We had the Steve's shrimp cocktail as an appetizer. They were large in size and very tasty. A wood flavor. Flavorful and good texture. He ordered the rib eye. I ordered the filet tips and lobster tail. Both steaks were cooked perfectly and were exactly what they should be - tender, juicy and delicious. The lobster tail was succulent. Probably the best I've had. (I've not been to the east coast.) The salad is good. The bread is brought in from a local bakery - baked fresh every day. Great place! We'll be back!! This will be a special occasion place though, as the prices are a little higher than what we typically pay on a night out. 4 large shrimp = $16. Filet tips and lobster tail = $35. 14 oz Ribeye = $28. The entrees include salad and a side of either fries, sweet potato fries or a baked potato. Bread and butter are also provided. It's a great place, and very enjoyable, we're just typically more frugal - unless we're celebrating a special occasion.
The salad totally sucked, and the service wasn't great, but the steak was fantastic and made the visit worth it.  Don't put a dirty green cherry tomato on my plate...

We visited on Saturday night for a late dinner and couldn't be happier with the service, ambiance and the food!  Ordered the swordfish and it was amazing.  Contrary to another review I saw the entree's were reasonable and include a salad and loaded baked potato or other potato option.  The salad was very good as well.  Try it, you will be happy you did.

We ate at DC Steak House the first weekend it opened.  We have been consistent patrons for years.  However, we have been increasingly disappointed in our experience over the last 12 months.  It is obvious they have changed food vendors - not the same quality.  Visit before this one we ordered carrot cake "it is not in season"....really?  Tonight we sat in view of the kitchen - food consistently sat in the window (while servers waiting on food did not expedite to the waiting tables) - fish sat in the window for 10 min, steak sat in the window for 10 min waiting on a baked potato.....as fast as restaurants turn over in Chandler, if DC Steakhouse doesn't assess  quality and refocus on service, they may not be around to benefit from the new entertainment district under construction to the North.

Had dinner here tonight. 10 ounce New York Strip. Average cut of meat at best. Have had much better off my backyard grill. Ordered medium rare, got a medium well steak.   Service and atmosphere were both nice but I see no need to return for average food at above average prices.
Meh. Not worth the high prices. And they charge $10 to split an entree. The food is ok, but did not blow my socks off.  Service was ok.  There are equally good, or better, places that cost less.

I went to DC Steakhouse Monday evening.  Was seated immediately.  I restaurant never got crowded, but did have a fair amount of business for Monday.  Service was excellent.  Our server was prompt, brought drinks right away, knew the menu very well.  No complaints about service  5 stars.  So my friend ordered the petite filet, and I took the servers advise and ordered the strip.  We both ordered our steaks medium-rare.  I told   the server I was not afraid of rare, and would rather have it more rare than less.  He assured me they cook true rare.   Both our steak came out medium to medium well.  In my mind, unacceptable in a steak house, particularly when I made it clear I wanted it truly pink in the middle.  I should have done like I have to do at Black Angus or Outback and order it rare...and hope i get med-rare.  All their steaks come with sauteed mushrooms on them.  I am not against sauteed mushrooms...but if you're proud of your steak, why would you put mushrooms on top?  My feeling is...they're not proud of their steak.  Sides were very good.  I saw a wedge salad another table ordered and it looked great.  The cocktails were great.  So...not so good steak, hidden in sauteed mushrooms, but very good service and cocktails.    I would not go back for dinner.  I could get the same quality steak cheaper at a chain place, or go to a good steak house and get what I wanted.  I see no reason to go to DC Steak House for a steak.

My sisters and I had dinner Sunday night.  Greeted at the the door by Mandy the hostess with the mostest sets the mood for a very enjoyable night.  After martini's and wine we  were ready for dinner.  By the way, try the kiwi strawberry Lemondrop.  Yum!   Daniel our waiter took care of all our needs without hovering.  We had Lobsters and a bone in ribeye cooked to perfection.  We love to keep our money in our neighborhood and will return often.

It's so nice to see the Downtown Chandler area revitalized and one restaurant that contributes to this is DC Steakhouse.  I have been to DCS numerous times now and each time has been very enjoyable.  I usually get a filet and lobster tail combo which is always perfectly cooked.  The wait staff is always professional and knowledgable.  The ambiance is very nice; a little urban chic.  DCS has a nice bar area and a nice selection of wines and spirits.  DCS is a great place for a romantic dinner or a night out with friends.  You really can't go wrong.

A friend suggested this place and we decided to try it on Friday. I was pleasantly surprised! Great service. We tried the calamari and it was good. I had the wedge salad and liked it. Also tried the filet - well done! -  and it was cooked perfectly. My suggestions for improvement would be expanding offerings of wine by the glass (great selections by the bottle --Duckhorn!,), but pretty limited by the glass. Also, desserts - chocolate cake too rich and little cupcake a bit stale. But I would definitely return.

Remember 98 South Wine Bar?... or the 2nd 98 South Wine Bar?... or Fat Cat?  That space in Downtown Chandler has a new tenant, and they seem like a keeper.  DC Steak House is a rarity in Phoenix; a mid-priced, independent steak houses in a sea of chain restaurants and a la carte wallet busters.  Looks:  Well, it does look fairly similar to the previous restaurants, except they changed the bar area and the art.  I like it.  It's elegant and not too dark or too partitioned.  There's a mural on one wall that I think the owner painted.  The place is a nice addition to Downtown, which is still fighting off the urban sprawl of mega-chains.  Crowd:  Seemed happening, although it was Opening Night.  A wide mix of young and old.  Food:  My eye was drawn to the large selection of fish, but I decided to go with steak at a steak house.  The salad was solid.  I especially liked the Italian dressing with a little Feta cheese in it.  Bread was OK.  My steak was great, tender, flavorful, and perfectly cooked.  Served with a (undercooked) baked potato, and sauteed mushrooms.  My friend ordered the walleye.  I was a big fan, but he said it was a little bland compared to what he catches in Minnesota.  Maybe that was a fish story.  Value:  Here's where I thought this place shined.  Meals were in the $18-30 range, including salad and potato.  They have $10 sandwiches, too, but they're not served on Fri/Sat until after 9pm.  Seems fair.  Service:  Service was slow, although it was Opening Night.  They also screwed up my friend's appetizer, serving him the wrong kind of wing sauce.  However, the people could not have been nicer.  The owner apologized and bought us desserts.  (Chocolate Decadence Cake was delicious, although a little rich for my taste.)  Then, the chef came out , shook our hands, and bought us drinks.  I felt like I was in a place where people would remember my name, even though they surely won't.  Miscellaneous:  A lot of decisions haven't been made yet.  Will they serve lunch?  What will they do for happy hour? (a crucial decision in my mind.)  Even the menu will likely vary in the coming months.  Verdict:  I don't go out for steaks often, even reasonably priced ones, but I'll definitely be back to DC Steakhouse to see my new "friends."  I've got my eye on the steak sandwich for next time.

Based on the reviews from Trip Advisor, I decided to try this local establishment. We called and left a message for reservations as the restaurant was not open during the day.  My request for the outdoor seating was granted.  We arrived at the restaurant and it was not crowded, but for a Tuesday I think doing just fine.  The waitress was good and explained the meals to us.  The prices here are above average, but that is OK.  I didn't want to go to a chain restaurant.  The appetizer we started with was a Zucchini which was just OK.  Not bad, but OK.  Wouldn't get it again.  The main meals came out and we were surprised.  I had Veal and Lobster and the Lobster was great.  Sweat and tender.  The Veal chop was good, not great.  A bit tough, but flavorful.  My guests all had fish and they all said it was delicious.  When I polled everyone that was there, they all agreed that this needed a second trip and that it was worth the first trip.  I will go again, try a different dish and support the local owner.  You should too.

Well...a lot of old people wearing running shoes and track suits. Not quite sure what that's about. Don't be fooled by the mozzarella and marinara appetizer, it's deep fried cheese sticks. Bread served room temperature (hint: invest in a bread warmer). Caesar salad- No anchovies. Filet- nice grill marks don't make a great steak. Basically flavorless and tastes just like the poor cuts I've bought at area butchers. Grilled shrimp was great but the cocktail sauce it was served with was pretty lame.  Ownership- you really need to take your managers and "chefs" on a little trip to some great steakhouses, institutions. Start in San Francisco first and then NY.   Oh, and please source better quality beef. Grass fed tastes so much better than corn fed.

My husband and I were wandering around before the Tumbleweed Christmas Tree lighting and we were hungry!  All the restaurants were packed with parade goers, shoppers, etc.  Of course we were not dressed for the upscale DC Steakhouse...well, we asked and they said they would take us, no problem!  Yes, it was crowded, but they found us a table and we had the yummiest dinner!!  My husband had a steak, which was so tender he could cut it with his fork!  I ordered the steak salad, which was absolutely delicious!!!  The steak pieces were plentiful, very tender and the taste was spectacular!!  The service was friendly, helpful and amazingly fast!  What a nice surprise!

The good: My fish was excellent! The martinis were shaken perfectly.  Our server was really nice and even offered to write us a list a places to go since we are new to the area.  The bad: Who still makes a house salad with iceberg lettuce?   The ugly: The manager was super cranky when we asked him to snap a quick photos of us.

Ya know, it's really tough to enjoy a meal when your experience with the hostess rubs you the wrong way right when you walk in the door.  We met some good friends there this past Thursday, and were there to use our groupon.  They have a two year old - which normally isn't even worth mentioning, but that's where it went horribly wrong with the hostess.  For some reason, she looked down on us - and not just because she's taller.  Basically she said they had a table in the back where we wouldn't bother anyone with the "child".  I realize that restaurants such as these are normally quieter, more intimate, less rowdy, so it's not what she suggested, it's how she said it.  Our friend's child happens to be very well behaved, but she assumed we would be a distraction or a nuisance.  The fact that she was a ginger, while not affecting her poor courtesy, is still worth mentioning.  The server was attentive, for the most part, with the exception of drink refills.  I can't comment on the quality of the steak, because everyone I was with who ordered steak ordered it wrong (medium well / well done).  The food, for the most part, was forgettable, and unfortunately, we will not be back.  Luckily it was a cheap night thanks to groupon!!

This is a special restaurant for me and my boyfriend- birthdays, anniversaries, celebrations- not just our typical Friday night dinner. It's by far our favorite restaurant. We have been to DC steakhouse probably ten times and I have never had a bad meal there.   First of all, whether you sit at a table or at the bar, your going to have awesome service. Not only are all of the waiters and waitresses super attentive and friendly, but I have not once been in and not seen the owner there, clearing tables, running food, making drinks. You know that any restaurant where the owner is there and takes pride in his business is going to be an extraordinary experience.   We always start with the fried mushrooms as an app, and I'm obsessed with the wasabi salad dressing for my dinner salad. But the important part of the meal, the entrees, are what we go there for. My boyfriend always gets the pan fried shrimp with the filet and a lobster tail. He won't even try anything else and he always leaves feeling more full than any normal person should ever feel. I switch it up every time. I've had every type of fish on the menu, the chicken and pasta, the lamb, and the veal. I am not joking when I say I have not had a bad meal. And we very rarely make it to dessert, even on special celebrations.  I recommend this place to anyone in the area, and sometimes they have groupons which make it an extra great deal!

Honestly, I know everyone really likes this place but I think it's just alright. For the price of the plates, you're really just paying for your typically nice steak place. The atmosphere is very elegant and dark, so it's a great date place and the food is good. But I wasn't blown away by anything here in particular. I've had friends who've said it's the best steak they've ever had, but I disagree. To their credit, my dad makes the best steaks on the planet (with the exception of one place in Park City, UT), so I've been spoiled on real steak all my life!

Despite some of the other mostly lukewarm reviews (which usually impact our decision to try a new restaurant), we decided to brave it.   After a short 30-minute wait (not bad for a busy Saturday night) we were seated and served drinks promptly. I ordered the first Cabernet on the menu and  (recommended by our uber-cool waiter Gavin) and it was good...in fact they do a pretty good pour.   The interior looks completely different from the 98 South days, but is still really cool with murals of a "downtown Chandler circa early 1900's with a bit of contemporary flair." There is outside patio seating which is fantastic on a spring night.   While many were dressed casually (shorts and golf shirts), this isn't a pub or bar atmosphere. I'd recommend it for a date night or pseudo-nice evening out so dress comfortably but not flip-flops and ripped jeans.  I'm sure the place is fine with kids, but I'd recommend against bringing them unless they're really well-behaved since there's a lot of hustle and bustle.   The bread was warm and fresh.Our salads were also fresh and uncomplicated, and the wasabi cream dressing was really flavorful.  I ordered the filet mignon and my hubby ordered the pike...they were both cooked to order, had great flavor and very tasty! They must have listened to some of the reviews and gotten it together because everything from the service, ambience, apps and entrees were great!   The prices were really reasonable ($24 for a 9 oz. filet, with bread, salad and baked potato.)   Unfortunately we were too full to handle dessert, but we'll definitely be back to try that too.  I'd actually rate DC Steak House 4.5 stars if I could, but Yelp doesn't have that as an option.)  I recommend you check it out and see for yourself!!
Excellent food and service. It's a tight fit in this old building, so conversation can get a little loud, but the quality of the food more than makes up for it! One of our local favorites!
Went there for the first time last weekend.  The NY strip was to die for, and the service was excellent!  Only complaint was the noise level.
Yesterday ,will be the last time your cook will serve us under cooked raw fish, with a burnt bottom. This has happened 3 times in the past 2 months. Need to find a new cook, I'm DONE

When we choose to dine at a steakhouse. We know we will be spending money and our specific group goes to spend money and have a good dining experience. The risk of a steakhouse is if they do it up right. They profit good money by our bill, receive good reviews promoting their Business and receive our return business, (which in the end brings them profit - which is the whole idea of running a restaurant). If The steakhouse falls short in its service and most importantly if they fail to cook a steak as ordered. The price of the steak is on them. - Tonight even after reading the reviews, we decided to give DC Ranch a try. After all 3.5 stars is still decent.  We didn't come to this restaurant to get a discount or to receive free food but if you or your staff screwed up then it is up to you to make the experience right. us your customers can choose where to spend our money and dine else where.    2nd time here. Last time.  This place survives solely on people not knowing better obviously.

We've been to DC Steak House several times and had excellent service and food.  Unfortunately, I can't say the same for our experience on Saturday night.  My children took me out for Mothers Day and I ordered the baby back ribs.  I've had them three times previously and they were fall off the bone tender.  This time, they were not tender at all.  In order to eat them, I had to pick them up and chew off the bone.  My daughter got the same ribs and they were as I previously experienced - fall off the bone tender.  I sent my ribs back (I was told that my daughter got the ribs from the "appetizer portions" and I got the ribs from the "main course" portion - apparently the baby-back ribs are different according to what you order.  My husband and kids were completely finished with their meals when my replacement dinner finally arrived.  I asked to have the dinner boxed up since everyone else was finished and asked what adjustment would be made on the bill.  The "manager" said that no adjustment would be made if I took the dinner to-go, but the dinner would be taken off the bill if I didn't take the dinner.  The upshot of the evening was that I didn't get dinner and the manager had no interest at all in whether we returned or not.  It's definitely an "Or Not".  Blue 32 has ribs that are far better, cheaper and with great customer service.  We've seen the last of DC Steakhouse.

Out first visit and the service was outstanding. Our server joe was very friendly and knowledgable of the menu. He was funny and moved us to a different table so my wife and I could sit next to each other. That was awesome!!!  Drinks and appetizer were really good. They would have gotten 5 stars, but the main course was great. It's quality didn't match the service, atmosphere, or price. It was more like a chain restaurant. They need to step their game up in that arena.

Special occasion Monday night dinner! We started with Shrimp & Crab balls, Caprese and Shrimp cocktail. Caprese was awesome, large thick slices of ripe tomato and mozzarella generously dressed with really good olive oil & balsamic. Shrimp were fresh and large and although they seem a little pricey the quality makes them a great value!  I enjoyed Mama's pasta which was really great! Pasta cooked perfectly, sauce was thick, rich and full of flavor. Swordfish is seriously amazing. We ordered both Cajun and grilled and they were both great!  Tara was a fantastic server and after hearing us talk about loving pepperocinis over our salads brought us a plate of extras without being asked. She was super attentive and casual we didn't feel rushed at all. It wasn't a busy Monday night but we were there for a long time waiting on someone running late.   Atmosphere is comfortable, the historic building is awesome and everyone had a beautiful evening! Will definitely be back!

Husband and I visited for a special date night. The whole experience was good, but the 5 stars is specifically for the ribeye steak. I ordered it medium rare. It was one of the best steaks I've ever had in my life. Extremely juicy and charred just right. If you go, get the ribeye!

My wife and I went to DC Steak House for our Anniversary and it was mostly a great dinner. Our server was new, so he didn't know certain questions we had but was a friendly young man that tried hard to please us. Make sure you bring bread to the table. lol...  I had the Bone in Ribeye which was very good, but a bit over salted for my taste. I asked for a Medium Rare Steak and it was more like Medium Well, but it was good anyway.  My wife had their 8-ounce, Filet Mignon which she loved.  They gave us a dessert to share complimentary for our Anniversary which was delicious. The prices are a bit on the higher end and I would recommend making reservations since it filled up fast, but it was a Friday night. Thanks DC for the dessert...  Overall, I would go back again and try something else, but it is a steakhouse and they did it right. I do recommend them. :)
HORRIBLE service and food as well. We ordered shrimp cocktail which never came out but we did get our dinner about a bit more than an hour after we ordered it. Terrible experience

I love down  town chandler, and this place is a great date spot. My husband and I frequent here when we want a date night, its cozy and has a great atmosphere. The steaks are very good, and for starters try the cheese curds in the wasabi ranch... amazing! I am a fan of this place and will continue to go back. Its a bit pricey, but worth it!

There were four of us who decided last minute to go out for dinner. We wanted to try a restaurant that we had never been to before. On a Saturday night at 6 p.m. we arrived at D.C. Steak House. They were already filling up and had many reservations. The hostess was kind enough to work things out to accommodate our party. From the moment that we met the hostess and the minute we paid our bill we had an enjoyable dinner with delicious food, outstanding service and friendliness from every employee we encountered. The steak and prime rib was fabulous. My husband and friend each has fish entrees. One was walleye and the other was an evening special. They were both delicious as well. I highly recommend D.C. Steak House and encourage you to make a reservation. We were so lucky that the hostess went out of her way to get us in. We WILL be back!

Mixed review: A group of 10 of us went over to DC last weekend to celebrate a friend's new job. It was nice that we were able to get a reservation by leaving a message, but then upon arrival they were missing a seat- but they fixed that quickly.  The place was VERY loud, not sure if that's because of the set up (everyone all piled into a huge room) or the acoustics of the place but it reminded me of my elementary school cafeteria. The rather dark lighting did make it seem fancy despite the noise.  Our server was pretty quick, but she did skip getting my husband's drink order- but he's a calm guy so he didn't care all that much.
